page.title: 09Maes-y-groes Farm,Cilcain(3)
page.content: Sheep: About 370 Welsh Half-Bred breeding ewes are kept.These are mated with Suffolk rams in the autumn and the lambs are born in March.The sheep are brought down from the higher ground to the farm to avoid the worst of the winter weather and are kept inside for lambing. The sheep are housed in groups in semi-open sheds, but the ewes are placed in individual pens for the birth of the lambs.Since many have twins,500 lambs may be born. The ewes and their lambs are allowed outside after the first day or two. In mid-April most of the sheep and lambs are returned to the higher land. About 80 ewes and their lambs may be kept on better grazing nearer the farm: these lambs are fattened more quickly for earlier sale. The remaining lambs are weaned by mid-August and sold throughout the autumn.
